title: Strictly Come Dancing pro Gorka is narked after being denied a starring role
text:

Strictly pro Gorka Marquez appears at loggerheads with BBC bosses - and Kevin Clifton – after being denied a starring role on the show.

The star, who is only in the group dances this year, retweeted a series of angry messages questioning why Kevin was drafted in to replace injured Neil Jones and not him.

They included one fan who blasted: “Gorka deserved it not Kevin who already had a partner this year”.

Another message he retweeted said: “Should have be Gorks not King Kev.”

A third read: “So we’re all in agreement that it should be Gorka dancing tonight, right?

(Image: TV Grab)

"Like the whole point is that him and Graziano DiPrima are there to step in as replacements if one of the other male pros get injured.”

He also liked a tweet calling Strictly bosses “arses” for the decision.

Clifton stepped in to dance with Alex Scott just hours Jones injured himself during training on Saturday morning and was unable to perform.

Clifton, 37, had been eliminated in the second week alongside his celebrity partner Anneka Rice

Despite having just 40 minutes to rehearse with Clifton, Scott earned praise from the judges and a total score of 34 out of a possible 40.

Documentary maker Stacey Dooley, 32, who split with her ex-partner during her time on the show, revealed on Twitter that boyfriend Clifton had had less than an hour with Scott.

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

In a video, she said: “Yes Kev. That’s why you are the damn king. He had 40 minutes to learn that routine. I am so proud.”

Jones thanked Clifton in a tweet following their performance.

He said: “Proud is not the word. @AlexScott just went out their under pressure and smashed that routine. @keviclifton.

“Thank you so much for what you have done tonight it means a lot to me.”

They danced a couples’ choice street/commercial routine to Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr, dressed in the franchise’s famous boiler suits and brandishing plastic guns.

After the dance, Clifton admitted to the judges that he made a few mistakes, but credited Scott with keeping the performance on track.

Bruno Tonioli said that, irrespective of her new partner, it had been her “best dance ever”.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Gorka - who was paired up with Katie Piper for the 2018 run and dates Gemma Atkinson, who also appeared on the show - told followers he had not been paired with a celebrity earlier this year.

He said: “I’m excited to see this year’s celebs and my fellow professionals dance for the Glitter Ball and I hope to be back fighting for it next year.”

His announcement came a day after fellow Strictly pro Graziano Di Prima also announced he won’t be in a featured spot

Gorka’s partner Gemma, mother of their daughter Mia, admitted the change had left her “sad”.

She noted on Instagram : “Sad to not be seeing Gorks partnered up and fighting it out for the Glitter Ball this year... ‘he’s my favourite’.”
description: EXCLUSIVE: Strictly fans come out in favour of Gorka Marquez while Kevin Clifton steps up to replace Neil Jones
